questions.q: How do you create a pivot table in Excel?
questions.a: You select your data range, go to the Insert tab, and choose Pivot Table.
questions.evaluation: Correct. The answer includes the right steps.

questions.q: Write a formula to calculate the average of cells A1 to A10.
questions.evaluation: Incorrect. Candidate confused SUM with AVERAGE. Correct formula is =AVERAGE(A1:A10).

questions.q: What is the difference between VLOOKUP and INDEX-MATCH?
questions.a: VLOOKUP looks up values only from left to right, while INDEX-MATCH can work in any direction and is more flexible.
questions.evaluation: Strong answer. Demonstrates understanding of flexibility and directionality.

questions.a: Conditional formatting changes cell color based on conditions like values or formulas.
questions.evaluation: Correct. Could have added examples (e.g., highlighting negative values).

final_report.strengths: Strong conceptual understanding (pivot tables, INDEX-MATCH, conditional formatting).
final_report.weaknesses: Needs more precision in formulas (AVERAGE vs SUM).
final_report.feedback: Review Excel formulas carefully; otherwise excellent performance.
